description: Amidst perceptions that public sector and philanthropic support for local communities is increasingly scarce, many community development practitioners are turning to social enterprise as a means to improve social and economic conditions in their neighborhoods. This course will examine and evaluate a number of recognized social enterprises tackling housing, workforce development, and job creation challenges, including several planned field visits. Building on their understanding of these fields, students will then divide into groups and develop business plans for their own social enterprises.
name: SOCIAL ENTREPRENEURSHIP
